tr.td: Client shares is a household contact of a person with bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis (TB). A household contact person who shared the same enclosed living space as the index case for one or more nights or for frequent or extended daytime periods during the 3 months before the start of current treatment.

tr.td: A state of persistent immune response to stimulation by M. tuberculosis antigens with no evidence of clinically manifest active tuberculosis (TB). This is also at times referred to as tuberculosis (TB) infection. There is no gold standard test for direct identification of M. tuberculosis infection in humans. Most infected people have no signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) but are at risk for active tuberculosis (TB) disease.

text.value: Whether the client has active TB
Active status as defined for reporting indicators
Whether a person has had treatment for tuberculosis (TB) and was declared cured or completed treatment
The date when the client was diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB)
Client should be tested for a latent tuberculosis (TB) infection (LTBI)
Client is currently taking TPT
The date on which the client began taking TPT
The date the client stopped taking TPT (before completing the treatment)
The client successfully completed TPT
The date on which the client completed TPT
Client has previously been treated for tuberculosis (TB)

Client shares is a household contact of a person with bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis (TB). A household contact person who shared the same enclosed living space as the index case for one or more nights or for frequent or extended daytime periods during the 3 months before the start of current treatment.
The type of screening for active tuberculosis (TB) that was performed
A screening for tuberculosis (TB) was performed
Symptoms that may indicate active TB in clients living with HIV, based on a clinical algorithm
Client does not report or exhibit active symptoms of TB
Client had a history of a contact with a person with TB

A state of persistent immune response to stimulation by M. tuberculosis antigens with no evidence of clinically manifest active tuberculosis (TB). This is also at times referred to as tuberculosis (TB) infection. There is no gold standard test for direct identification of M. tuberculosis infection in humans. Most infected people have no signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) but are at risk for active tuberculosis (TB) disease.
Record the result of the tuberculosis (TB) screening
Date the tuberculosis test was conducted
The type of diagnostic test performed to detect active tuberculosis (TB)
Client is currently being treated for tuberculosis (TB)
The date on which the client start or restarted tuberculosis (TB) treatment
The date the client stopped tuberculosis (TB) treatment (before completing the treatment)
The client successfully completed tuberculosis (TB) treatment
The date on which the client completed tuberculosis (TB) treatment
The facility where the client is receiving tuberculosis (TB) treatment
TB drugs currently being taken by the client
Client is eligible for tuberculosis preventive treatment (TPT)
Date when a determination of the client's eligibility for TPT was made
Client's tuberculosis (TB) status when antiretroviral therapy (ART) is started

Treatment offered to individuals who are considered at risk of tuberculosis (TB) disease in order to reduce that risk. Also referred to as treatment of tuberculosis (TB) infection, LTBI treatment or tuberculosis (TB) preventive therapy.
Infant has been exposed to tuberculosis (TB)
TB status as defined for reporting indicators
TB meningitis
The date on which the client has a test for C reactive protein
Test result of the client's C reactive protein test
Date of diagnosis of active TB
